About Me

If we run app.js and answer all of the required prompts from the command line, we should see that both index.html and style.css were created in dist. If it doesn't look like this, or if there is an error printed to the command line, double-check that the dist folder is created in the correct location, directly at the root of the project's directory.

Work

run-buddy

Built With: JavaScript, HTML, CSS

Essentially, we wait for confirmation that the .writeFile() method ran successfully. When we get that confirmation, which in this case simply means not receiving an error, we then execute the .copyFile() method. It isn't mandatory for the application to work, but it does make the application run its functions one at a time, making it easier for us to track what's going on when.

View Project on GitHub

Weather Dashboard

Built With: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap

To execute the code in order, let's try and have the fs.copyFile() functionality occur inside the callback function for fs.writeFile(). This way, we know that the .writeFile() method successfully created the HTML file before we even attempt to copy the CSS file.

View Project on GitHub

Taskinator

Built With: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, ES6, jQuery

We must always consider this when dealing with asynchronous code. We can have both of the fs functions run concurrently, because one isn't dependent on the other, but that could make it harder for us to determine what went wrong if an error occurs.

Built With: JavaScript, HTML
